brand_info.name: Coca-Cola
brand_info.positioning: Iconic sparkling soft drink positioned as an everyday symbol of refreshment, optimism, and shared moments.
brand_info.vision: Craft the brands and choice of drinks that people love, to refresh them in body and spirit, and do it in ways that create a more sustainable business and better shared future. citeturn0search0
brand_info.mission: Refresh the world. Make a difference. citeturn0search0
brand_info.origin_story: Created in Atlanta, Georgia, with the first serving poured on May 8, 1886 at Jacobs' Pharmacy; developed by Dr. John S. Pemberton and named by Frank Robinson. citeturn0search2turn0search15

brand_values.brand_promise: Deliver a uniquely recognizable refreshment ritual that elevates ordinary moments into shared, positive experiences.
differentiators: Iconic Spencerian-script trademark and contour bottle equity
Campaign storytelling centered on human connection and uplifting refreshment
non_negotiables: Trademark and packaging equity must remain intact
Never undermine product safety, legality, or responsible enjoyment
Avoid cynical or negative emotional framing that conflicts with optimism

demographics.age_range: All (core emphasis on teens to adults)

psychographics.lifestyle: Social, on-the-go, and occasion-driven consumers who value shared rituals and small moments of enjoyment.
psychographics.behavior: Chooses Coca-Cola in moments of eating, socializing, entertainment, sport, and everyday breaks; responds to uplifting, human-centered storytelling.

tone_of_voice.communication_style: Simple, direct, and emotionally positive; emphasizes real moments and shared connection.

logo.primary_logo: Coca-Cola Spencerian-script trademark (primary wordmark); may appear as a curved 'Hug' expression in refreshed identity executions. citeturn1search0
logo.usage_rules: Trademark must remain crisp, high-contrast, and unobstructed; never distort, re-letter, or apply effects that reduce recognition.
logo.lockup_behavior: Logo appears as a clear, iconic stamp: top corner, center, or integrated with packaging; maintain generous clear space.
logo.safe_area: Minimum clear space equals at least the height of the 'C' in the wordmark on all sides.

color_system.color_usage_rules: Red is the primary brand anchor; use white as high-contrast field; black used sparingly for typography and premium contrast; avoid off-brand neon palettes that compete with Coca-Cola Red.

typography.primary_font: Brand-led wordmark plus clean, bold sans-serif for UI and headlines
typography.secondary_font: Neutral sans-serif for body copy and legal

layout_principles.white_space_ratio: Balanced: generous negative space in premium executions; fuller frames in energetic social moments
layout_principles.cta_placement: Lower third, aligned to grid and safe areas
layout_principles.alignment: Clean, bold alignment; avoid clutter and overlapping elements

style.camera_feel: Candid realism with premium polish; emphasis on refreshment cues and human connection.
style.pose_guidelines: Natural interaction: sharing, sipping, eating together, celebration gestures; expressions read as genuine and present.
style.casting_attitude: Inclusive, diverse, everyday aspirational; friendly confidence and warmth.

technical.lighting: Bright natural daylight or clean, high-impact key light for product; highlights emphasize coldness and condensation cues.
technical.contrast: Medium to high with crisp separation of red, white, and product silhouette
technical.grain: Low to subtle; clean modern finish
technical.depth_of_field: Moderate; keep product and key faces sharp, backgrounds softly separated
technical.color_grading: Fresh, vibrant reds with neutral skin tones; avoid heavy stylized tints that shift Coca-Cola Red

contexts: Cultural moments and creator collaborations under the Real Magic platform. citeturn1search0turn1search10

model_casting.attitude: Warm, open, present; authentic connection and uplift

product_presentation.hero_visibility: Product is a recognizable hero, often in-hand or center-adjacent; label and silhouette remain readable and canonical.
product_presentation.styling_approach: Everyday wardrobe and lifestyle styling; keep focus on the moment and the serve (ice-cold cues, condensation, fizz).
avoid: Overly staged luxury tropes that disconnect from everyday accessibility

motion_rules.pacing: Lively and rhythmic with human micro-moments; punctuate with iconic product hero beats.
motion_rules.transitions: Clean cuts and match-action; occasional graphic brand wipes in red-white language

visual_dos: Use Coca-Cola Red as the primary anchor
Emphasize refreshment cues: ice, condensation, fizz, clink of glass
Keep composition bold and readable at distance
visual_donts: Do not recolor the brand red into off-brand hues
Do not distort the logo or packaging proportions
Avoid cluttered typographic overlays on faces or label areas
Avoid negative or cynical emotional framing
copy_dos: Anchor messaging to moments and togetherness
copy_donts: Avoid hard-sell discount language as the main message
Avoid technical product explanations in hero copy

must_remain: Human connection and optimism as emotional center
can_evolve: Visual craft level from candid social to premium hero
test_zone: Limited-edition innovation and experiences under Coca-Cola Creations
Interactive and digital experiences under Create Real Magic. citeturn1search10turn1search2

interactive_elements: Sampling moments and social photo points
Iconic bottle or can silhouette signage
retail.soundscape: Upbeat, friendly, contemporary pop with broad appeal

digital.tone_adjustment: More playful and creator-friendly while staying optimistic and brand-safe

platform_behavior.Instagram: Moment-driven reels and carousels with crisp red-white branding and short copy
platform_behavior.Website: Brand platform storytelling plus product information hubs
platform_behavior.Newsletter: Short highlights, seasonal moments, community initiatives

print.paper: Gloss or satin stock to support strong reds and product highlights
print.cover_rules: Full-bleed moment or product hero; minimal copy; logo in clear safe area with high contrast

logo_misuse_examples: Overlaying the logo across faces or label-critical areas
